Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Decade \Dec"ade\, n. [F. d['e]cade, L. decas, -adis, fr. Gr. ?, fr. de`ka ten. See {Ten}.] A group or division of ten; esp., a period of ten years; a decennium; as, a decade of years or days; a decade of soldiers; the second decade of Livy. [Written also {decad}.] [1913 Webster]
During this notable decade of years. --Gladstone.
decade n 1: a period of 10 years [syn: {decennary}, {decennium}] 2: the cardinal number that is the sum of nine and one; the base of the decimal system [syn: {ten}, {10}, {X}, {tenner}]
